renewables.title: Top 10 countries with the highest renewable energy production
renewables.p1: Renewable energy is an energy source that is obtained from natural resources that are naturally replenished, such as sunlight, wind, rain, tides, waves, and geothermal heat.
renewables.p2: Renewable energy is an alternative to non-renewable energy, which is obtained from finite resources, such as coal, oil, and natural gas.

chart.legend: * Graph of the 10 countries that consume the most renewable energy. (TWh)

nonRenewables.title: Top 10 countries with the highest non-renewable energy production
nonRenewables.p1: Non-renewable energy is an energy source that is obtained from finite resources, such as coal, oil, and natural gas.
nonRenewables.p2: Non-renewable energy is an alternative to renewable energy, which is obtained from natural resources that are naturally replenished, such as sunlight, wind, rain, tides, waves, and geothermal heat.

chart.legend: * Graph of the 10 countries that consume the most non-renewable energy. (TWh)
